instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
I have a board here <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it have signs of previous cleaning, with some junk here and there, but did not find any corrosion.

This board turn os with charged battery, works fina and stable. 
Charger only stays green and it sees the charger and battery, but won't charge.
I cleaned the board properly and did some measures on the current sensing circuit, all resistors seems to be fine.

I'am suspecting of a bad SMC, I need a little help with some SMC measurements, to state if just crap under it or it its failing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: If it runs off the battery and see the percentage SMC is fine. Most likely cause is corroded resistors/traces in current sense circuit. Measure at the pins of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> between 17/18 and 27/28. Make sure all power is removed and discharged!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> measurements in diode mode with no charger and no battery:

From pins 17/18 - 139
From pins 27/28 - 018 and beeping! 

Im looking at this line but <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 9.8ohms both.
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR> no short.

Bad ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: 17/18 is not correct so corroded resistor or trace in that circuit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> reading 89ohms, should be 0 right?
I'll replace it and test again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: Yes that is what it says on the schematic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
Replaced <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> and pins 17/18 now beeps.
removed <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> still beep.
removed ISL still beep.

Checked on a donor board pins 17/18 should be around 1000?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: Of course it will beep, it should read about 3 Ohm. Put back ISL and it will work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
Ok, that confused me, my donor board must be faulty at this region too, it's not beeping.
All this lines goes to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> that is just 0.02ohms, now I see, thanks for the help!
I'll post result soon.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message:
ISL placed pins 17/18 beeps, pins 27/28 beeps, all resistors on this line ok, no shorted caps, still not charging.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> getting a little hot, don't know if this behavior is normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: Looks like its oscillating from 11v to 16v with battery disconnected and magsafe 60w(genuine)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, turns on but do not charge the battery
threads.message: That still means the ISL is not able to regulate PPBUS. Check again resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 at the pins of the ISL. If they are in the 3 Ohm and 20Ohm range that is ok. Could still be a bad ISL too.
